content.raw:
I guess the concern is with backward compatibility of serialized messages, that might have been saved on disk previously or are generated by code that links against msgs4. If this is not a concern, we can ignore my comment.

> If there's a concern with .proto, how does that affect msgs6 once we remove the 9? (i.e. when we remove deprecated fields, should we leave an empty number? I checked it compiles, but I haven't looked at documentation.)

https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/proto3#updating suggests renaming the field instead of removing it.
content.html:
I guess the concern is with backward compatibility of serialized messages, that might have been saved on disk previously or are generated by code that links against msgs4. If this is not a concern, we can ignore my comment.

If there's a concern with .proto, how does that affect msgs6 once we remove the 9? (i.e. when we remove deprecated fields, should we leave an empty number? I checked it compiles, but I haven't looked at documentation.)

https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/proto3#updating suggests renaming the field instead of removing it.
